name: Huli Jing
description: The Huli Jing can transform into a stunning human or a nine-tailed fox, showcasing a blend of beauty and cunning. Its fox form features fiery red fur and ethereal tails.
memorable: Its unique ability to change shape and manipulate luck makes it a significant threat in combat and social situations.
goals: To charm and manipulate others while using strategy in combat.
relations: Often associated with other fey creatures, and can manipulate or charm beings it encounters.
environment: Typically found in wooded or mystical areas that resonate with fey magic.
strengths: High Charisma and dexterity, versatile in combat, and possesses strong manipulation and illusion spells.
weaknesses: Vulnerable to cold iron attacks and relies heavily on deception and spellcasting.
attacks: Uses bite attacks in fox form and jade daggers in humanoid form; both deal piercing and psychic damage.
most_powerful_ability: Draining Glance allows the Huli Jing to inflict significant psychic damage and regain health.
senses: With a passive perception of 21, the Huli Jing excels at detecting hidden foes and threats.
skills: Highly skilled in perception and persuasion, enabling effective charm and deception.
additional_information: Shapechanger ability for versatility in encounters
Curse of Luck can hinder multiple opponents
Can regain health through its Draining Glance ability
spellcasting: Innate spellcaster focused on Charisma, capable of casting enchantments and illusions.
test_queries: fey monster that manipulates luck and charm
psychic damage dealing shapechanger in combat
beautiful fey that uses illusion spells
